Data science for all

For a long time, statistical and digital methods were restricted to hard sciences. Fortunately, historians and humanists can now benefit from data science as well. This webpage provides programming lessons on the use of data science in digital humanities. Learn to conduct efficient statistical analyses and show your insights with beautiful visualizations.

CODING LESSONS

  • Changing ggplot colors with scale_color_brewer

    • Medium
    • R
    • 10 min
    Use RColorBrewer to choose professional color palettes.

  • Use Matplotlib line plot to create clear and compelling visualizations

    • Medium
    • Python
    • 20 min
    Use Matplotlib to plot and highlight elements in historical trends in 8 steps.

  • R programming for climate data analysis and visualization

    • Advanced
    • R
    • 30 min
    Learn the basics of linear regression models and how to use them to study the relationship between two variables.

  • Climate Data Visualization

    • Medium
    • R
    • 20 min
    Would you like to contribute to raise awareness about global warming? In this lesson you will learn how to create your own ggplot2 themes to code compelling plots showing historical weather data.

  • Where To Find And How To Load Historical Data

    • Easy
    • Python
    • R
    • 10 min
    Learn 5 great websites to find reliable historical data and how to load it in R and Python.
